com.martensigwart.fakeload

Class AbstractLoadSimulator

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.martensigwart.fakeload.AbstractLoadSimulator
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    LoadSimulator, Runnable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    CpuSimulator, DiskInputSimulator, DiskOutputSimulator, MemorySimulator

    public abstract class AbstractLoadSimulator
extends Object
implements LoadSimulator
    Skeleton LoadSimulator implementation.

    Load is simulated by running a while loop inside the run() method. In the loop the executing thread waits when there is nothing to do as indicated by waitConditionFulfilled() method. When there is something to simulate, load gets simulated via the simulateLoad(long) method which has to be implemented by subclasses.

    Note: When calling the constructor of this class from a subclass, passing a value smaller or equal zero as maximumLoad will cause the max value to be Long.MAX_VALUE

    Since:
    1.8
    Author:
    Marten Sigwart

    • Method Detail

      • simulateLoad

        protected abstract void simulateLoad(long load)
                              throws InterruptedException
        Simulates the specified system load.

        Actual system load simulation happens inside this method. However, the simulation logic implemented here should be kept as short and concise as possible as this method is called from within a while loop internally. Therefore, this method should not start any infinite loops, etc.

        Parameters:
        load - the load to be simulated
        Throws:
        InterruptedException - when the thread is interrupted during load simulation

      • waitConditionFulfilled

        protected abstract boolean waitConditionFulfilled()
        Represents the 'wait' condition of an AbstractLoadSimulator. In order to save resources, the thread executing the run() method should wait when there is nothing to simulate.

        Take for example, a simulator which simulates memory. If it has already allocated the desired amount of memory it has nothing more left to do. In this case the corresponding thread should wait until it retrieves new simulation instructions.

        This method is responsible for checking if a simulator currently has something to do or not.

        Returns:
        returns true if there is nothing to do and false otherwise.

      • cleanUp

        protected abstract void cleanUp()
        Clean up method which is called if the thread executing this AbstractLoadSimulator encounters an exception, e.g. InterruptedException. This method should be used to clean up any resources that are used by the simulator for load simulation purposes.

        protected abstract String prettyFormat(long load)

        Parameters:
        load - load to be formatted
        Returns:
        Returns a pretty string

      • run

        public void run()
        Description copied from interface: LoadSimulator
        Executes the simulation logic. This method should be used to implement the simulator's main simulation logic, i.e. the actual system load (CPU, memory, etc.) for which this LoadSimulator is responsible should be simulated.

        From Runnable.run():

        Specified by:
        run in interface LoadSimulator
        Specified by:
        run in interface Runnable
